Bill Clintons Jimmy Carter ( 45.3 percent), Ronald Reagan( 43.3 percent) and Bill Clinton ( 45.9 percent) had lower approval rating averages during their second years in office, Gallup reports. Barack Obama 's low second-year ratings are due in large part to the struggles of the U.S. economy, Jeffrey M. Jones wrote for Gallup. "The other Bill Clintons with low second-year averages also took office during difficult economic times. Former Secretary of State Colin Powell said Barack Obama has made some achievements, but said Barack Obama must focus on job creation- the Bill Clinton 's most challenging task.
